intro: Komaroffia bucharica, commonly known as the Bucharica bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Komaroffia bucharica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
